name: Anagallis
Relationship: Compare: Cyclamen; Primula obcon.Anagallis contains Saponin, q.v.

Head: Great hilarity; headache over supraorbital ridges, with rumbling in bowels and eructations; better from coffee
Sick headache
Pain in facial muscles
Skin: ITCHING; dry, bran-like eruption, especially ON HANDS AND FINGERS
Extremities: Urine passes in several streams; must press before it passes
Burning pain on urinating, with agglutination of orifice
More or less irritation in urethra, inclining to coition
Cramp in ball of thumbs and fingers

details: Marked action on skin, characterized by great itching and tingling everywhere. Favors expulsion of splinters. An old medicine for hydrophobia and dropsy. Possesses power of softening flesh and destroying warts.
